INCORPORATION.

We are pleased to learn that there is likely to be some attempt made to bring this question more directly before the people. The inhabitants of Edmonton and other places in the north have been working hard to get their town incorporated, and now is the time for them to do so. We believe that the North West Council will meet in August and take up this matter again. It is important that the people should be informed of the advantages of incorporation, and we urge them to take advantage of this opportunity.

There is some probability that a public meeting will be called to consider this matter. We believe that the North West Council will take action soon, and we urge all citizens to attend these meetings and express their opinions.

Public matters are just now at an impasse. Subscriptions for the new school building have been received, but the work has not yet begun. We urge all citizens to contribute to this worthy cause.

THE POST OFFICE.

In both Manitoba and the North West Territories the unexpected rush of immigrants into almost unoccupied localities has been the cause of towns springing into existence. If this trend continues, it is inevitable that the location of the future town will be a matter of considerable difficulty for the Government to select the site for the Post Office. In both cases, the Post Office buildings are located near the center of the town.

The Government cannot be aware that the Post Office is an inconvenience to the town. It is true that the Post Office is an inconvenience to the town, but the Government cannot be aware that the Post Office is an inconvenience to the town.

QUEEN VICTORIA CENSORED.

Presbyterians the world over are noted for their fearless denunciation of what they regard as the errors of the Church of Scotland. They have just published a report on religion and morals, in which Queen Victoria is censured for permitting the desecration of the Sabbath through the political messengers. This report is not only a blow between Aberdeen and Bellator, but also a blow against the political parties in the United States.
